docs.lead_paragraph: It is hard enough to take baby teeth seriously, since they're going to fall out in a few years. It is even harder to imagine worrying about a baby's gums before the first teeth erupt.

headline.main: PARENTS/CHILDREN; Dental Health Starts Before Teeth Appear

docs.abstract: Dr Stephen J Moss, NYU children's dentistry dept chmn and author of new book Your Child's Teeth, urges parents to clean baby's teeth (M)
docs.snippet: It is hard enough to take baby teeth seriously, since they're going to fall out in a few years. It is even harder to imagine worrying about a baby's gums before the first teeth erupt.
